Manx: Arrane: Ta’n Imbagh Arree Nish ec Kione.
English: Song: The Season of Spring Now Ended.
Diplomatic: Arrane: Ta’n imbagh arree nish eck kione

Manx: Ta’n imbagh arree nish ec kione
English: The season of Spring is now at an end
Diplomatic: Ta’n imbagh arree nish eck kione

Manx: As yn ghrian heose slane ayns bree
English: And the sun above full in power
Diplomatic: As yn ghrain house slane ayns bree

Manx: Son nish ta mee ny boaldyn ayn
English: For now is the month of May
Diplomatic: Son nish ta mee ny moaldyn ayn

Manx: As yn gheay wooar ee hene ec shee
English: And the great wind itself at peace
Diplomatic: As yn gheay wooar ee hene eck shee

Manx: Ny sumarkyn ta nish ayns blaa
English: The primroses that are now in bloom
Diplomatic: Ny sommeryn ta nish ayns blaa

Manx: Ny lussyn ta mie as glass
English: The herbs that are good and green
Diplomatic: Ny lodderyn ta mie as ghlass

Manx: Ny biljyn ooyl myrgeddin ta
English: The apple trees are also
Diplomatic: Ny biljyn oyl morgheddyn ta

Manx: Blaaghey ga nagh vel monney çhiass
English: Blooming although there isn’t much heat
Diplomatic: Blaaghey gha nagh vel monney chass

Manx: Ny-yeih ta’n imbagh aalin shoh
English: Nevertheless, this beautiful season
Diplomatic: Ny-yeih ta’n imbagh aalin shoh

Manx: Cur er yn faiyr gaase ayns dagh easan
English: Makes the grass grow in every little waterfall
Diplomatic: Chur er yn faiyr gaase ayns dagh esan

Manx: Ny biljyn juys ayns coamrey noa
English: The fir trees in new clothing
Diplomatic: Ny biljyn juse ayns coamrey noa

Manx: Agh biljyn unjin ta feer ghoan
English: But ash trees that are very scarce
Diplomatic: Agh biljyn unjen ta feer ghoan

Manx: Ta’n tourey aalin gerjagh dou
English: The beautiful Summer comforts me
Diplomatic: Ta’n thourey aalin gherjagh dow

Manx: Tra nagh vel feme aym soie dy çhiow
English: When I have no need to sit to heat (warm)
Diplomatic: Tra nagh vel feme aym soie dy chow

Manx: Agh er ny croink as sleityn shooyl
English: But walk the hills and mountains
Diplomatic: Agh er ny croink as sleityn shooyl

Manx: Ta’n earish aalin taitnysagh
English: The weather is delightfully beautiful
Diplomatic: Ta’n earish aalin taitnysagh

Manx: Tra ta mee nish ayns my henn eash
English: When I am now in my old age
Diplomatic: Tra ta mee nish ayns my chen eash

Manx: Ny-yeih jeh’n faarkey lhean goaill baght
English: Nevertheless, surveying the broad ocean
Diplomatic: Ny-yeih jelin faarkey lheayn ghoaill baght

Manx: Tra ta mee shooyl er croink Chrenaish
English: When I am walking the hills of Cregneash
Diplomatic: Tra ta mee shooyl er croink crenaish

Manx: Ny-yeih ta’n traa dy oyragh gholl
English: Nevertheless, the time goes reasonabley
Diplomatic: Ny-yeih ta’n tra dy oyragh gholl

Manx: As ta my vea gaase giare dagh laa
English: And my life grows short each day
Diplomatic: As ta my vea gaase gayre dagh laa

Manx: Dy lheah bee’m eiyrit veih my oayl
English: Soon I’ll be driven from my haunt
Diplomatic: Dy lheay bee’m eiyrit veih my oayl

Manx: Gys boayl voish cha vel nane çhyndaa
English: To a place from whence no-one returns
Diplomatic: Gys boayl voish cha vel nane chyndaa

Manx: O uss ta coyrt dagh bannaght sheese
English: O you, who sends each blessing down,
Diplomatic: O uss ta churt dagh bannagh sheese

Manx: Dagh gioot as grayse ta çheet voyd Hene
English: Every gift and grace, that comes from you yourself.
Diplomatic: Dagh gooit as graase ta cheet void Hene

Manx: Nish ayns dty ghraih as dty erreeish
English: Now in love and compassion,
Diplomatic: Nish ayns dy ghraih as dy eerish

Manx: Er coontey Chreest gow çhymmey jee’m
English: On account of Christ take pity on me,
Diplomatic: Er coontey Chreest gow chymmey jee’m

Manx: Croo aynym cree glen O my Hiarn
English: Create within me a pure heart my Lord
Diplomatic: Chroo aynym chree glen O my Hiarn

Manx: As cur yn spyrryd noo çheu sthie
English: And put the holy spirit within me.
Diplomatic: As chur yn spyrrys noo cheu stie

Manx: Gow mee dhyt hene chouds bee’m er mayrn
English: Take me to yourself for as long as I live
Diplomatic: Ghow mee dhyt hene chouds bee’m er marn

Manx: As eisht cur lesh my annym thie
English: And then bring my soul home
Diplomatic: As esht cur lesh my annym thie

Manx: Dy ooashlagh mysh dty stoyl reeoil
English: To worship around your royal throne
Diplomatic: Dy ooashlagh mysh dy stoal reeoille

Manx: As ve dy bragh mayrt hene ec shee
English: And be forever with you yourself at peace
Diplomatic: As ve dy braagh maart hene eck shee

Manx: Ayns eunys Niau dy ve gerjoil
English: In the rapture of Heaven to be happy
Diplomatic: Asyns eunys Niau dy ve gherjoill

Manx: Raad nagh vod peccah reesht cur snieh.
English: Where sin cannot give vexation again.
Diplomatic: Raad nagh vod peccah reesht chut snee.

Manx: May 17 1899    Farquhar
English: May 17 1899    Farquhar
Diplomatic: May 17 1899    Farquhar
